title: Samosa Sandwich
description:
'This sandwich has samosa as the filling, and it is served as a chaat with the chutneys and sev
'
ingredients: Fresh coriander leaves chopped   for garnish
method: To make each sandwich, apply butter on bread slices followed by green chutney. Press the samosas lightly and place on 4 bread slices.
Top with a few onion roundels and a few tomato roundels. Sprinkle salt and place a slice of cheese on top. Cover each with one of the remaining bread slices, chutney side facing downwards.

Heat a non-stick tawa. Add some butter, place 1 sandwich and apply some more butter on top. When the underside turns golden, flip and cook till the other side too turns golden. Cook the remaining sandwiches similarly.
Cut each sandwich into 4 equal squares and place them on separate serving plates.  Drizzle tamarind chutney and green chutney. Sprinkle sev and coriander leaves and serve immediately.

title: Sattu ki Kachori
description:
'Golden and crisp kachoris filled with a spicy and flavorful sattu mixture
'
method: To make the dough, take refined flour in a large bowl, add carom seeds, salt and mix well. Add ghee and rub till well combined. Add water little by little and knead into a semi-stiff dough. Cover with damp muslin cloth and set aside for 10-15 minutes.
To make the stuffing, heat ghee in a non-stick pan, add fennel seeds, asafoetida, green chillies and ginger, mix well and sauté till fragrant.
Add onion, mix and sauté till translucent. Add Jeera Sattu and mix till well combined.
Add red chilli powder, turmeric powder, coriander powder, cumin powder and salt, and mix well.
Add ½ cup water, mix well and cook for 1-2 minutes. Transfer into a bowl and let it cool down.
Heat sufficient oil in a kadai.
Divide the dough into equal portions, apply a little oil to each portion and shape them into a katori with your fingers.
Add coriander leaves and dried mango powder to the sattu mixture and mix well.

Stuff each dough katori with some sattu mixture, gather the edges together and pinch to seal.  
.
Apply a little oil on each stuffed ball, spread slightly with your fingers keeping the edges thinner than the center and further roll into a slightly thick round kachori
Slide the kachoris into medium hot oil, 2 at a time, and deep-fry till crisp and golden on all sides. Drain on absorbent paper.
Keep the kachoris on a serving plate and serve hot with coriander-mint chutney and beetroot sonth.

title: Rawa Toast
description:
'Bread slices topped with a spicy rawa mixture and pan fried
'
method: Take semolina in a bowl, add salt and yogurt and mix well. Let it rest for 10-15 minutes.
Add onion, tomato, capsicum, red chillies and coriander leaves and mix well.
Place each white bread slice on the worktop and spread a generous portion of the semolina mixture evenly on it.

To cook each slice, heat 1 tbsp butter in a non-stick pan on medium heat, when the butter melts, place a slice in it, with the mixture side facing up. Sprinkle some cheese and some white sesame seeds on it. When the underside turns golden, flip and cook till the other side turns golden brown.
Cut each slice into 2 triangles, keep them on a serving plate and serve hot with tomato ketchup.

title: Rasam Vada
description:
'Urad dal vadas served with piping hot rasam – a wonderful and spicy snack that will completely satiate your palate
'
ingredients: Split pigeon pea (toor dal/arhar dal) soaked for 30 minutes and drained  4 tablespoons
method: Transfer split pigeon peas into a pressure cooker, add 3 cups water, salt and ½ tsp turmeric powder and let the mixture come to a boil. Put the lid on and cook under pressure till 4-5 whistles are released.
Meanwhile, heat a non-stick pan on medium heat, add dried red chillies, black peppercorns and cumin seeds and dry roast till fragrant.
Transfer the spices into a blender jar, add ginger and grind. Add sufficient water and further grind into fine paste.
Open the lid of the cooker once the pressure settles completely and strain the mixture into a jar.

Heat 2 cups of water in a deep non-stick pan, add tomato, rasam powder, asafoetida, remaining turmeric powder, tamarind pulp, ground spice paste and salt, mix well and cook till the mixture is reduced to half. Add the strained dal water and mix well and let the mixture come to a boil.
Heat ghee in a small non-stick pan, add mustard seeds and let them splutter. Add curry leaves and a pinch of asafetida, mix and sauté for a few seconds.
Add this tempering to the rasam mixture and mix. Add crushed peppercorns and  coriander leaves and mix well.
Place a vada in each serving plate and pour the hot rasam over it. Serve hot.
main_ingredients: Split pigeon pea (toor dal/arhar dal) (तुवर दाल/अरहर दाल),  Urad dal vadas

title: Rajma Pulao
description:
'Rajma masala and rice is a great combination, but here both are combined in one dish – just tasty
'
ingredients: Red kidney beans (rajma) (soaked overnight and ¾ cooked) and cooking water   1 cup
Rice  soaked for 30 minutes and drained   1 1/2
method: Heat ghee in a pressure cooker, add peppercorns, cloves, green cardamoms and onions, mix well and saute till the onions turn golden brown.
Add tomatoes and tomato puree, mix and saute till the oil separates.
Add red chilli powder, turmeric powder, garam masala powder, coriander leaves and cooked red kidney beans and mix well.
Add rice, salt and 3 cups of the reserved cooking water and mix well.
Place the lid on the cooker and cook under pressure till 4 whistles are released. Open the cooker once the pressure settles completely.
Transfer into a serving bowl, garnish with coriander sprig and serve hot.

title: Railway Mutton Curry
description:
'The origins of this recipe can be traced to the British Raj in Calcutta when the Britishers enjoyed this mutton curry albeit in a less spicy version
'
ingredients: Mutton cut into 2 inch pieces on the bone  500 grams
method: Take mutton pieces in a bowl, add Turmeric Powder, red chilli powder,  salt, ginger paste, garlic paste, mustard oil and yogurt and mix well. Keep aside to marinate for at least 3 hours.
To make the paste, heat a non-stick pan, fennel seeds, cumin seeds, black peppercorns and broken red chillies, mix and dry roast till fragrant.
Put ginger and garlic cloves in a blender jar, add the roasted spices, coriander powder, mustard oil, red chilli powder and a little water and blend to a fine paste.
To make gravy, heat mustard oil in a pressure cooker till it smokes. Add bay leaves and onion, mix and sauté.  Add a little salt and sugar, mix well and continue to saute.

Meanwhile, heat the same non-stick pan, add green cardamoms, cinnamon and cloves and dry roast till fragrant. Transfer into a blender jar and blend coarsely. Put this into the cooker, mix well and saute till onion turns golden.
Add potatoes, mix well and saute for 4-6 minutes. Add ginger paste and garlic paste, mix and sauté for 1-2 minutes.
Add tomato puree, mix well. Add a little salt, mix well and saute till the oil separates and the mixture thickens slightly.
Whisk the yogurt till smooth. Reduce heat and add yogurt to the cooker, mix well and cook for 4-5 minutes.

Add the marinated mutton and mix well. Add the spice paste and mix well. Cook for 3-4 minutes. Add nutmeg powder and mix well. Place the lid on and cook under pressure for 4-5 whistles. Allow the pressure to settle completely.
Take it off the heat and transfer into a serving bowl. Garnish with coriander sprig and serve hot with steamed rice.

title: Prawn Omlette
description:
'This delicious combination of prawns and eggs make for a satiating breakfast
'
ingredients: Medium prawns shelled, deveined and washed  20-24
method: For each portion break 2 eggs into a bowl, add salt and whisk well with a fork.
Heat 1 tbsp oil in a non-stick pan, add half the green chillies, half the onion and half the tomato, mix and saute for 1-2 minutes.
Add salt, ¼ tsp turmeric powder and ½ tsp red chilli powder and mix well. Add half the prawns, mix and sauté for 1-2 minutes.
Add half the mushrooms, mix well and cook for 1-2 minute. Spread this mixture evenly and pour the eggs over them. Sprinkle half the coriander leaves and half cheese. Cover and cook for 2-3 minutes.
Loosen the edges and fold the omelette in half. Halve the omelette and slide each half onto a serving plate. Serve hot with toasted bread slices.
Cook the remaining eggs and prawns similarly.
main_ingredients: Medium prawns (मध्यम आकार के प्रॉन्स),  Eggs (अंडे)

title: Quick Peanut Potatoes
description:
'Potatoes and peanuts cooked with some simple ingredients make a delicious dish
'
method: Heat ghee in a non-stick pan, add white sesame seeds and curry leaves and saute till the seeds have changed colour.
Add peanuts and sautÃ© on medium heat for 3-4 minutes or till the peanuts are well sauteed. Add ginger-green chilli paste, mix well.
Add potatoes, salt, sugar and coriander leaves, mix well and saute for 3-4 minutes.
Transfer into a serving bowl, garnish with coriander sprig and serve hot.

title: Prawn Alu Wadi
description:
'Seafood makeover of the popular Maharashtrian snack 
'
ingredients: Small prawns shelled, deveined, washed & drained well  3/4 cup
method: Take prawns in a bowl, add salt and Â½ tsp turmeric powder and mix well. Add 1 tbsp tamarind paste and mix till well coated.

Take Fine Besan in another bowl, add rice flour, remaining tamarind paste, jaggery, salt, garam masala powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, remaining turmeric powder, red chilli powder and sufficient water and whisk till you get a thick and smooth paste.
Place the colocasia leaves on a worktop, wipe them dry, cut the stalks off each leaf and remove the central vein from the backside of the leaves.

Place one leaf with the backside facing up, apply some besan paste evenly all over it, place another leaf over it with its pointed end facing in the opposite direction and apply some besan paste evenly.

Spread some marinated prawns on top evenly. Fold both the vertical edges slightly and roll tightly from the bottom towards the top. Apply a little paste on the open edge and seal. Make more rolls with the remaining leaves, besan paste and prawns.
Heat sufficient water in the lower section of a steamer, place the rolls on the perforated section, cover with the lid and steam for 15-20 minutes.
Remove the rolls from the steamer and place on the worktop and let them cool slightly. Thickly slice the rolls.

Heat sufficient oil in a shallow non-stick pan, add sesame seeds and let them change colour. Place the wadis and shallow-fry, turning sides, till golden and crisp on both sides. Drain on absorbent paper.
Arrange the slices on a serving platter, garnish with coconut and coriander leaves and serve immediately with coconut chutney.
main_ingredients: Small prawns (छोटे प्रॉन्स/ झींगे),  Colocasia leaves

title: Poha Aloo Tikki
description:
'Poha gives the much loved aloo tikki an additional crispness that is very pleasing
'
ingredients: Potatoes boiled, peeled and mashed  4 medium
method: Put beaten rice in a strainer and keep it over a large bowl. Pour sufficient water over it and keep it aside for 10-15 minutes.

Take mashed potatoes in another bowl, add red chilli powder, turmeric powder, cumin seeds, green chillies, chaat masala, lemon juice, cornflour, salt, crushed cashew nuts and the soaked poha and mix well.
Heat sufficient oil in a kadai.
Divide the mixture into equal portions and shape them into tikkis. Slide them into the hot oil and deep-fry till golden brown and crisp. Drain on absorbent paper.
Arrange them on a serving platter and serve hot with tomato ketchup.

title: Piri Piri Roast Chicken
description:
'Piri piri spice mix is a spicy mix that elevates the taste of the grilled chicken to a new level
'
method: Take chicken legs in a bowl, add piri piri spice mix, salt, parsley, olive oil, squeeze the juice of ½ lemon and rub in all over the chicken legs. Set aside to marinate for 30 minutes.
Preheat the oven at 150˚C.  Keep a rack in a baking tray.
Place the chicken legs on the rack in the baking tray, keep it in the preheated oven and bake for 30-35 minutes.
Take the chicken legs out of the oven and halve them. Keep some mashed potatoes on a serving plate and arrange sautéed vegetables on side. Keep the chicken legs over them and serve immediately.
main_ingredients: Chicken legs (चिकन टंगड़ी),  Piri piri spice mix

title: Paneer Khada Pav Bhaji
description:
'In this pav bhaji the vegetables are not mashed but the taste is just as delicious
'
ingredients: Fresh coriander leaves chopped 2 tablespoons + to garnish
method: Heat butter and oil on a non-stick tawa. Add onions and sauté till light golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste, mix and sauté till raw smells disappear. Add tomatoes, mix and sauté for 4-5 minutes.
Add red chilli powder, chilli paste and ¼ cup water and mix well. Add salt and mix. Add ¼ cup water, mix and saute for 2-3 minutes. Add pav bhaji masala and mix well. Add ½ cup water and mix well.
Add potatoes, cauliflower, capsicum, green peas, mix well and cook for 3-4 minutes.
Add cottage cheese, ½ cup water and salt, mix well and cook for 2-3 minutes. Add coriander leaves and mix.
Transfer into a serving plate, sprinkle coriander leaves on top and serve hot with toasted pavs and lemon wedges.

title: Paneer Chur Chur Roll
description:
'Crisp lachha paratha topped with green chutney and paneer tikka, rolled and served
'
ingredients: Whole wheat flour (atta) 1 1/2 cups + for dusting
method: Take whole wheat flour in a mixing bowl, add yogurt, 1 tsp ghee, salt and sufficient water and knead to soft dough. Cover and let it rest for 5-10 minutes.

Divide the dough into equal portions and shape them into balls. Dust some flour on the worktop and roll out each ball into a small disc. Spread Â½ tbsp ghee on each disc and sprinkle dry flour. Give a slit from the center to the edge on one side and roll to form a cone. Flatten, dust some more flour and roll out into a thin disc.

Heat a non-stick tawa, roast the paranthe, one at a time, and cook for 30 seconds. Flip, spread a little ghee and spread it evenly. Flip again, drizzle ghee on the other side and spread evenly. Cook, turning sides, till golden brown on both sides. Transfer on a plate and crush lightly to separate layers.
Spread some green chutney on each parantha, place a few pieces of paneer tikka in the center. Sprinkle some onions and sprinkle chaat masala on top and roll.
Place the rolls on individual serving plates and serve with salad and green chutney.

title: Palak Paneer Sandwich
description:
'These cheesy sandwiches are simply irresistible 
'
method: Heat oil in a non-stick pan, add cumin seeds and saute till their colour changes. Add garlic and green chilli, mix and sauté for 1 minute.
Add spinach, mix and sauté for 1 minute. Add salt, mix and sauté for 1-2 minutes. Transfer into a bowl.
Add cottage cheese, processed cheese and mozzarella cheese and mix well.
Apply butter on one side of 4 slices of bread, spread a generous portion of stuffing on each evenly. Cover with remaining slices of bread and apply butter on top.
Heat a griller, grease it with a little butter and place 2 sandwiches, at a time, on it with the butter side up, close and grill till evenly golden on both sides.
Cut the sandwiches in half diagonally and place them serving platter. Serve hot with French fries and tomato ketchup.
main_ingredients: Spinach leaves (palak) (पालक के पत्ते ),  Paneer (cottage cheese) (पनीर)

title: Seekh Kebab Bread Omlette
description:
'Seekh kebabs, eggs and bread cooked in a way to make a wholesome snack â€“ ideal for a late breakfast on a Sunday
'
method: Break 4 eggs into a bowl and beat well. Add half the onion, half the tomato, half the coriander leaves, half the green chillies and salt and mix well.
Heat a non-stick tawa, add 2 tbsps butter and when it melts add 2 kebabs, and cook rotating them till evenly golden on all sides. Drain onto a plate.
Keeping some of the egg mixture back, pour the rest on the same tawa and spread it evenly. Keep 2 white bread slices on the eggs side by side and press slightly. Cook on medium heat for 1-2 minutes.

Flip, place the kebabs in the center, fold the omelette on the kebabs. Dip 2 white bread slices in leftover egg mixture and place over omelette taking care that they are exactly over the earlier placed slices.
Apply butter on top of the bread slices, flip and cook the other side till golden brown. Cut from the center to make two sandwiches. Cook the remaining eggs and kebabs similarly.
Keep each sandwich on a separate serving plate and serve hot with green chutney.
main_ingredients: Seekh Kebab,  White bread slices (सफेद ब्रेड)

title: Rajma Puri
description:
'If you have boiled more rajma than you need for a curry, do not despair, knead them with whole wheat flour and make puris
'
ingredients: Kidney beans  boiled and mashed  1/2 cup
Oil 2 teaspoon + for greasing + for deep frying
method: Take whole wheat flour in a parat, add mashed kidney beans, Garam Masala, turmeric powder, red chilli powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, salt, carom seeds and ghee and mix well.
Add sufficient water and knead to stiff dough. Drizzle 2 tsps oil and knead again. Cover and rest the dough for 10-15 minutes.
Heat sufficient oil in a kadai.
Divide the dough into small equal portions and shape them into balls. Apply a little oil to each ball and roll out into small and slightly thick puris.
Slide each puri into hot oil and deep-fry till they puff up. Flip and fry till they  turn deep golden on both sides. Drain on absorbent paper.
Place some puris in each thali and serve hot with any sabzi.

title: Papad Churi
description:
'A quick, easy and very tasty side dish â€“ another way to serve papads
'
method: Roast the papads evenly on medium heat on both sides and set aside to cool slightly. Crush the roasted papads roughly and put them in a bowl.
Add red chilli powder, salt, coriander leaves, onion and ghee and mix well.
Transfer into a serving plate and serve immediately.
main_ingredients: Bikaner moong dal papad,  Red chilli powder (लाल मिर्च पावडर )

title: Mushroom Methi Malai
description:
'Fast tract version of the very popular mushroom dish 
'
method: Put 10-12 cashew nuts in a blender jar, add onion, ginger-garlic paste, green chillies and ¼ cup water blend to a fine paste.
Heat 1½ tbsps ghee in a non-stick pan, add caraway seeds, cloves, cinnamon and black peppercorns and sauté till fragrant.
Add the cashew nut-onion paste and mix well. Cook on low heat for 4-5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Meanwhile, heat remaining ghee in another non-stick pan, add button mushrooms,  sprinkle a little salt and saute till all the moisture in the mushrooms evaporate.
Break the remaining cashew nuts and add into the pan with mushrooms and mix well.
When oil begins to leave the cashew nut mixture, add yogurt, mix well and cook, stirring continuously, for 3-4 minutes.
Add Kasuri Methi to the mushrooms and mix well.
Discard the cinnamon from the gravy and add it to the mushroom-methi mixture and mix well.
Add salt and mix well. Add fresh cream, switch the heat off and mix well.
Transfer into a serving bowl and serve hot with roti.
main_ingredients: Button mushrooms (बटन मशरूम),  Dried fenugreek leaves (kasoori methi) (कसूरी मेथी )

title: Mixed Vegetable Restaurant Style
description:
'Mixed vegetables cooked in onion-tomato masala – restaurant style
'
ingredients: Carrots cut into 1 inch thick strips and boiled  2 medium
French beans cut into 1 inch pieces and boiled  7-8
Fresh coriander leaves chopped   for garnish
method: Heat oil in a non-stick wok, add cumin seeds and saute till the seeds change colour. Add onions, mix and sauté for 1-2 minutes.
Add garlic paste and ginger paste, mix and saute till onions turn golden brown.
Add turmeric powder, red chilli powder, cumin powder and coriander powder, mix well and saute on low heat for 1-2 minutes.
Add tomato puree and increase heat. Add salt, mix well and cook till the mixture thickens and the oil separates.
Add cashew nut-melon seed paste, mix well and saute for 1-2 minutes. Add carrots, cauliflower, French beans, capsicum, green peas and mix gently for 1-2 minutes. Switch the heat off.
Add fresh cream and mix well.
Heat a shallow non-stick pan, add Kasuri Methi and dry roast till fragrant. Crush between your palms and add it to the vegetable mixture and mix gently.
Transfer into a serving bowl, garnish with ginger strips and coriander leaves and serve hot with rumali roti.
main_ingredients: Carrots (गाजर),  Cauliflower florets (फूलगोभी के छोटे फूल )

title: Masoor Dal with Tomato
description:
'Make this flavorful masoor dal, a favorite of the Assamese, and serve it with rotis
'
ingredients: Split red lentil (masoor dal) soaked for 20 minutes  1 cup
Fresh coriander leaves chopped 1 tablespoon + for garnish
method: Drain and put split red lentils into a pressure cooker, add 3 cups of water, salt, turmeric powder and tomato and let the mixture come to a boil. Cover the cooker with the lid and cook under pressure till 2 whistles are given out.

Heat mustard oil in a deep non-stick pan till it begins to smoke. Add cumin seeds and once they change colour, add dried red chillies, mix and saute for 1 minute. Add cooked split red lentil, mix and cook for 2-3 minutes
Transfer into a serving bowl, garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot.
main_ingredients: Split red lentil (masoor dal) (मसूर दाल),  Turmeric powder (हल्दी का पावडर)

title: Mango Pani Puri
description:
'You have eaten tangy pani puri many times now try out this sweet and sour one â€“ it is totally lip smacking
'
ingredients: Raw mangoes boiled, peeled and pulped  3
method: To make aamras, squeeze out the flesh of the mango into a bowl. Add saffron, milk and sugar and blend with an electric hand blender till smooth.
To make stuffing, mash potato in another large bowl, add mixed sprouts, chaat masala, Chilli Powder, turmeric powder, salt and roasted cumin powder and mix well.
To make aam panna, take the raw mango pulp in a third large bowl, add sugar, roasted cumin powder, cinnamon powder, lemon juice, nutmeg powder, black salt and mint chutney and whisk well.
Add 1 cup water, mix well and blend with an electric hand blender till smooth. Add 2 cups of water and salt and mix well. Add salted boondi and mix well.
For each portion, make a hole on one side of 6 crisp puris and place them on a plate. Stuff each with some potato mixture, top with some aamras and some panna and serve immediately.
main_ingredients: Crisp Puffed Puris (पानी पूरी/ गोलगप्पे),  Amras

title: Nariyal Puri
description:
'Puris stuffed with spicy and flavorful coconut mixture
'
method: Take refined flour in a mixing bowl, add semolina, carom seeds, salt and 2 tbsps hot oil and mix well. Add sufficient water and knead into stiff dough. Rest the dough for 20-25 minutes.
To make the stuffing, take coconut in another bowl, add green chillies, coriander leaves and salt and mix well.

Divide the dough into 8 equal portions. Shape each portion into a katori with your fingers,  place a spoonful of stuffing in the centre, bring the edges together and pinch to seal and shape into a ball.
Heat sufficient oil in a kadai.
Dip each portion in a little oil and roll into a puri.  Slide it into the hot oil and deep-fry, turning sides, till golden on both sides. Drain on absorbent paper.
Place puris on a serving plate and serve hot.

title: Matar Malai
description:
'A rich, flavourful and delicious green peas curry 
'
method: Heat oil in a non-stick pan, add cumin seeds and asafoetida and let the seeds change colour. Add green peas, mix and sautÃ© for 2-3 minutes.
Add salt, turmeric powder, coriander powder and red chilli powder and mix well.
Add malai and mix well. Add garam masala powder and mix well.
Transfer into a serving bowl, garnish generously with malai and serve hot.

title: Masala Vada
description:
'Another version of medu vada – some masalas mixed with the batter before deep-frying
'
ingredients: Split black gram skinless (dhuli urad dal) soaked for 5-6 hours and drained  1 cup
Split Bengal gram (chana dal) soaked and drained  1 tablespoons
method: Put split black gram into a grinder jar, add ½ cup water and grind to a fine paste. Transfer the ground mixture in a bowl. Add curry leaves, green chillies, crushed peppercorns, coconut pieces, split Bengal gram, coriander leaves and salt and mix well.
Heat sufficient oil in a kadai. Dip your hand in water, drop small portions of the mixture into hot oil and deep-fry till golden brown and crisp. Drain on absorbent paper.
Arrange them on a serving plate and serve hot with coconut chutney and tomato chutney.
main_ingredients: Split black gram skinless (dhuli urad dal) (उड़द दाल धुली),  Curry leaves (कड़ी पत्ते )

title: Masala Vada
description:
'Another version of medu vada – some masalas mixed with the batter before deep-frying
'
ingredients: Split black gram skinless (dhuli urad dal) soaked for 5-6 hours and drained  1 cup
Split Bengal gram (chana dal) soaked and drained  1 tablespoons
method: Put split black gram into a grinder jar, add ½ cup water and grind to a fine paste. Transfer the ground mixture in a bowl. Add curry leaves, green chillies, crushed peppercorns, coconut pieces, split Bengal gram, coriander leaves and salt and mix well.
Heat sufficient oil in a kadai. Dip your hand in water, drop small portions of the mixture into hot oil and deep-fry till golden brown and crisp. Drain on absorbent paper.
Arrange them on a serving plate and serve hot with coconut chutney and tomato chutney.
main_ingredients: Split black gram skinless (dhuli urad dal) (उड़द दाल धुली),  Curry leaves (कड़ी पत्ते )

title: Mango Kadhi
description:
'Mango is perhaps the most versatile fruit – it can be eaten by itself or made into desserts or even to make savory dishes like kadhi
'
method: To make kadhi, take yogurt in a large bowl, add Tata Sampann Fine Besan and whisk till the mixture is smooth.
Add mango puree, turmeric powder, red chilli powder and salt and whisk well. Add 3 cups of water and whisk well.
Heat oil in a deep non-stick pan, add mustard seeds and let them splutter. Add asafoetida, ginger and broken dried red chillies, mix and sauté well.
Add the yogurt mixture. Rinse the bowl with ½ cup water and add to the pan and mix well. Cook on low heat, stirring occasionally, for 8-10 minutes.

Meanwhile, make the pakode heat sufficient oil in a kadai. Take fenugreek leaves in another bowl, add salt, turmeric powder, red chilli powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, asafoetida, Fine Besan and 2-3 tbsps water and mix well. Add 1-2 tbsps water more and baking soda and mix well
Drop small portions of this mixture with your fingers into hot oil and deep-fry till golden and crisp. Drain on absorbent paper.
Transfer the kadhi into a serving bowl, place the pakode on top and serve hot with steamed rice.

title: Rawa Dhokla
description:
'This is instant dhokla that is very easy on the palate and can be digested instantly too
'
method: Take semolina in a bowl, add yogurt and mix well. Add 1 cup water, mix well and rest the mixture for 10-15 minutes.
Heat sufficient water in a steamer. Grease a thali.
Add 1 cup water and mix well. Add ginger-green chilli paste, salt, fruit salt and 1 tbsp water, mix well. Pour the mixture into the greased thali.
Place the thali in the steamer and steam on medium heat for 10-15 minutes. Take the thali out of the steamer and let it cool slightly.
For the tempering, heat oil in a non-stick pan, add 1 tsp mustard seeds and let them splutter. Add asafoetida, curry leaves, broken red chilli and saute for 30 seconds.
Pour the prepared tempering on the dhokla and spread it evenly and cut into squares.
Arrange them on a serving platter and serve with green chutney.

title: Mixed Vegetable Raita
description:
'A simple yet delicious raita made with onion, cucumber and tomato
'
method: Finely chop onion, cucumber, tomato and sprigs of coriander leaves.
Heat a non-stick pan, add cumin seeds and dry toast till fragrant and lightly browned. Transfer into a mortar and pound to a coarse powder with the pestle.
Take yogurt in a bowl and whisk it well. Add onion, cucumber, tomato, coriander leaves, Â½ tsp roasted cumin powder and black salt and mix well.
Transfer into a serving bowl, garnish with some roasted cumin powder and serve.

title: Sev Khichia Papad
description:
'Crisp papads topped with a number of interesting ingredients to make an excellent snack to be had especially during monsoons
'
ingredients: Dried mango powder 1/4 teaspoon + for sprinkling
Red chilli powder 1/4 teaspoon + for sprinkling
Red chilli Garlic Chutney    as required
method: Dry roast the papads on direct flame till well done on both the sides.
Mash the potatoes into a bowl, add chaat masala powder, dried mango powder and red chilli powder, and mix well.

For each portion place 1 papad on a serving plate, keep another plate on it and press slightly so that the papad is broken into pieces. Drizzle a little butter, sprinkle some onion, some tomato, some raw mango, some peanuts, masala chana dal and some potato mixture.

Drizzle some red chilli-garlic chutney, some sweet tamarind chutney, some green chutney, sprinkle some chaat masala powder, some red chilli powder and drizzle a little yogurt. Garnish with some coriander leaves, some sev and some chana dal and serve immediately.

title: Sookhi Dal Amritsari
description:
'This is a dry lentil preparation which is very popular in Punjab and can be enjoyed with paranthas
'
ingredients: Split black gram skinless (dhuli urad dal)  soaked for 4 hours and drained  1 1/2 cups
Ginger  cut into thin strips chopped  1 inch
method: Heat oil in a non-stick pan, add cumin seeds and saute till they change colour. Add green chillies, mix and sauté for 30 seconds. Add ginger,  mix  and saute for 30 seconds. Add asafoetida, mix and sauté for 30 seconds.
Add onion, mix and sauté till golden brown. Add red chilli powder, turmeric powder and garam masala powder, mix well and saute for 30 seconds.
Add tomato and mix well. Add salt, mix well and saute till the tomato turns pulpy.
Add coriander leaves and split black gram and mix well. Add 1 cup water and mix well. Cover and cook till the gram is completely cooked and all the moisture is absorbed.
Transfer into a serving bowl, garnish with coriander sprig and serve hot.
main_ingredients: Split black gram skinless (dhuli urad dal) (उड़द दाल धुली),  Oil (ऑइल)

title: Spicy Fish
description:
'Fish fillets marinated in a spicy mixture, wrapped in butter paper and shallow fried to perfection
'
ingredients: Red snapper fillet cut into 3 inch pieces  1
method: Take the fish pieces in a shallow bowl and squeeze the juice of the lemon over them.  Add salt, rub in well on both sides of the fish pieces and set aside for 15-20 minutes.

Take paprika powder on a plate, add dried ginger powder, all spice powder, crushed black peppercorns, curry powder, cayenne pepper powder, cumin powder, salt and oil and mix well. Add the fish pieces and rub well till they are well coated with the spice mixture. Set aside to marinate for 10-15 minutes.
Place each fish piece on a piece of butter paper and fold the paper from all sides to make a parcel.
Heat remaining oil in a non-stick pan, place the fish parcels on it and cook for 1-2 minutes. Flip the parcels, cover and cook till the fish is cooked completely.
Discard the butter paper, and place the fish pieces on a serving plate. Garnish with lemon slices and serve hot with salad.

title: Sweetcorn Pasta
description:
'Pasta cooked in white sauce with plenty of colorful vegetables
'
ingredients: Whole wheat penne pasta boiled  1 cup
Red capsicum cut into ½ inch pieces  1 medium
Yellow capsicum cut into ½ inch pieces  1 medium
Green capsicum cut into ½ inch pieces  1 medium
Broccoli cut into florets and blanched  1/4 cup
method: Heat butter and olive oil in a non-stick wok, add garlic and sauté medium heat till it turns golden and its raw smell disappears.
Add red capsicum, yellow capsicum and green capsicum, mix and sauté for 2-3 minutes. Add white sauce and tomato ketchup, mix well and cook for 1-2 minutes.
Add pasta, mix well and cook for 2-3 minutes. Add broccoli, sweet corn kernels, salt and red chilli flakes, mix well and cook for 2-3 minutes on medium heat.
Transfer into a serving bowl, garnish with black pepper powder and parsley sprig and serve hot.
main_ingredients: Whole wheat penne pasta (गेहूँ का पेने पास्ता ),  Butter (मक्खन )

title: Tikkar Parantha
description:
'You can trace the origins of this masala paratha to Rajasthan
'
ingredients: Whole wheat flour (atta) 1/2 cup + for dusting   cup
method: You can trace the origins of this masala paratha to Rajasthan
Cover with a damp muslin cloth and rest the dough for 15 minutes.
Divide the dough into equal portions and roll them into balls.
Dust a little flour on the worktop, flatten each dough ball and roll into a paratha.
Heat a non-stick tawa, place each paratha on it, sprinkle a little onion and little tomato and press them gently and cook till the base is light golden.
Flip and apply a little ghee on top and cook for 1 minute. Flip and apply ghee and cook for 1 minute. Cook turning sides till both sides are evenly golden.
Keep the paranthe on serving plates and serve hot with green chutney.
main_ingredients: Cornmeal (मकई का आटा),  Whole wheat flour (atta) (आटा)

title: Tomato Rasam
description:
'The absolute comfort food, especially during a monsoon day. Enjoy it with your family
'
ingredients: Split pigeon pea (toor dal/arhar dal)   3 tablespoons
method: Take Toor Dal in a bowl, add sufficient water. Soak it for 20-25 minutes. Drain and cook it in a pressure cooker with 1 cup water, Â½ tsp asafoetida and turmeric powder till 4-5 whistles are given out. Take it out when the pressure settles, mash it well, add 3 cups water and mix well.
Meanwhile, heat a deep pan, add tomatoes, coriander leaves, rasam powder, salt and 2 cups water, mix well, cover and cook till the tomatoes soften.
Add the cooked dal and mix well. Add tamarind pulp and mix well. Reduce the heat, cover and let it come to a boil. Continue to boil till the mixture reduces a bit.
Meanwhile, dry roast black peppercorns and cumin seeds in a non-stick pan till fragrant. Transfer the mixture into a mixer jar and grind to a coarse powder.
Add this powder to the rasam, mix well and cook for 2-3 minutes.
For the tempering, heat ghee in the same pan, add mustard seeds, remaining asafoetida and curry leaves. When the seeds splutter, add it to the rasam, cover immediately and cook for 1 minute.
Serve it hot with rice and fried papad.

title: Veg Malai Sandwich
description:
'Malai adds a richness to the vegetable mixture that is very appealing
'
ingredients: Green chutney for applying + to serve
method: Take onion in a large bowl, add capsicum, carrot, green chillies, crushed black peppercorns, salt, fresh malai and mix till well combined.
Apply butter and green chutney on 4 white bread slices, spread some vegetable mixture on each evenly.
Sprinkle grated cheese and cover with remaining bread slices. Apply butter on top.
Heat a griller and place the prepared sandwich on it. Grill till golden brown marks appear on both sides. Take it off the heat.
Cut each sandwich into 2 triangles, keep them on a serving plate and serve hot with green chutney and tomato ketchup.

title: Vegetable Cheesy Bake
description:
'Mixed vegetables mixed with white sauce and cheese and baked to perfection
'
ingredients: Potatoes cut into small cubes  2 small
Carrot cut into small cubes  1 small
method: Preheat the oven to 180°C.
Heat oil in a non-stick wok, add garlic and onion, mix and sauté till translucent. Add potatoes and carrot, mix well and saute for 2 minutes.

Add broccoli, green peas and French beans, mix well and saute for 1 minute. Add mushrooms and mix well. Add salt and black pepper powder and toss well. Separate the leaves of thyme and add into the wok and mix well.
Add white sauce and mix well. Add sweet corn kernels, and mix well. Add ½ cup grated processed cheese and mix, cook for 1 minute.

Transfer into a baking dish and spread it evenly. Sprinkle dried breadcrumbs on top. Sprinkle remaining processed cheese and grate cheddar cheese on top. Keep the baking dish in the preheated oven and bake for 10-12 minutes.
Serve hot.

title: The Princess Cake
description:
'Chocolate cake dressed up like a princess with black and red colored royal icing
'
ingredients: Royal icing black coloured   as required
Royal icing red coloured   as required
method: Take refined flour in a bowl, add salt and 1 cup castor sugar and mix well. Make a well in the center, break in the eggs, add activated yeast and milk, mix well and knead into soft dough. Add butter and knead till well combined.
Put Â¾ cup castor sugar in another bowl, add cinnamon powder and mix well.
Dust the worktop with flour, keep the dough on it and roll into a rectangular sheet. Brush butter on it evenly and sprinkle the sugar-cinnamon mixture on it.
Roll the sheet from one end to the other, apply a little water on the open edge and seal. Cut into 8 half-inch pieces and press them lightly.
Place them on a greased baking tray and set aside to prove for 10-15 minutes.

title: Tawa Chicken Frankie
description:
'Who can refuse a Frankie – follow this recipe to make delicious a chicken Frankie 
'
method: Put the green chillies in a bowl, add vinegar, mix well and set aside to infuse.
Heat oil in a non-stick tawa, add onion, mix well and cook till golden brown.
Add red chilli powder, turmeric powder, coriander powder and cumin powder, mix well and saute for 30 seconds.
Add chicken, mix well and sauté on high heat for 3-4 minutes. Add salt and tomato, mix well and saute till the tomato is pulpy and chicken is completely cooked.
Add coriander leaves and mix well. Take it off the heat.
To make spice take red chilli powder, black salt, chaat masala, salt in a small bowl and mix well. Take beaten eggs in another bowl.

Heat a non-stick tawa. For each portion, place 1 roti on the tawa and cook for a minute on medium heat, flip and add some beaten egg and spread it evenly. Drizzle a little oil all around and on the top of the roti and cook for 1 minute. Flip and cook till the egg is cooked.

Take it off the tawa and place it on the worktop with egg side upwards. Place a portion of the chicken mixture on one end, top it with some onion slices, sprinkle some spice mix and drizzle green chilli vinegar and roll it into a Frankie.
Halve the Frankie diagonally and place them on a serving platter and serve it immediately with green chutney.
main_ingredients: Boneless chicken (हड्डी रहित चिकन),  Refined flour (maida) rotis (मैदे की रोटियाँ)

title: Thecha Prawns
description:
'Spicy but flavourful, this prawn dish is an absolute winner
'
ingredients: Medium prawns shelled, deveined, washed and patted dry  25
method: Remove the stems of the green chillies and chop them roughly.

To make thecha, heat 2 tbsps oil in a kadai, add cumin seeds and saute till their colour changes. Add garlic, mix and sauté for 2 minutes. Add peanuts, mix and sauté for 3-4 minutes or till golden brown. Add green chillies, mix well and sauté for 3-4 minutes. Add salt and mix well. Take it off the heat.
Transfer the mixture into a mortar and pound with the pestle to a coarse paste.
Take prawns in another bowl, add salt and turmeric powder, mix well and set aside for 10 minutes.
Heat 1½ tbsps oil in the same kadai, add the thecha and sauté for 1 minute.
Add prawns, mix well and saute till the prawns are cooked.
Transfer into a serving bowl and serve hot.
main_ingredients: Medium prawns (मध्यम आकार के प्रॉन्स),  Salt (नमक)

title: The Classic Combo
description:
'A delightful drink that will lift your sagging mood instantly
'
method: For each portion pour 30 ml cinnamon liqueur in a Boston shaker, add 30 ml gold rum and squeeze the juice of ½ lemon. Add ¼ tsp cinnamon powder and a few ice cubes. Place the lid on and shake it.
Put a few ice cubes in a serving glass, strain the mixture into it  till ½ filled. Pour apple soda till ¾ filled.

Pour 30 ml rum into a ladle and carefully set fire on it with a blow torch. Once it has caught fire, immediately pour over the drink. Stir well with a cinnamon stick and garnish with an apple fan. Serve immediately.

title: Tendli Pickle
description:
'This is instant tendli pickle that can be enjoyed with any meal or even with rotis
'
method: Dry roast salt in a non-stick pan till the moisture gets evaporated. Transfer into a bowl and let it cool down to room temperature.
Heat mustard oil in the same pan till it starts smoking. Take it off the heat and let it cool down to room temperature.
Meanwhile, trim both the edges of the ivy gourds and chop into small pieces. Transfer them into a large bowl.

Spread rai kuria in a circle on a plate. Spread methi kuria over it.  Spread asafoetida in the center and pour 1 tbsp mustard oil on it. Spread roasted salt in a circle over the methi kuria and sprinkle Turmeric Powder and mix well. Add  Kashimiri red chilli powder and spicy red chilli powder and mix well.
Add 3 tbsps mustard oil and mix well. Store in air tight container to use when required.
Add 5 tbsps of the masala to the tendli. Add a little salt and 1 tbsp spicy red chilli powder and remaining mustard oil and mix well.
Transfer into an airtight container and can be used upto 2-3 days but keep it in the refrigerator.

title: Tandoori Dhokla
description:
'Dhokla tossed in a tempering and tandoori masala
'
ingredients: Fresh coriander leaves chopped, for garnish
method: Take gram flour in a bowl, add turmeric powder, salt, ginger-green chilli paste, yogurt and sufficient water and mix well to make a smooth and semi-thick batter. Add oil and fruit salt and mix well.

Heat sufficient water in a steamer and grease a thali with oil. Pour the batter in the thali and place it in the steamer. Cover and steam for 10-12 minutes. Take the thali out of the steamer and set aside to cool slightly. Cut into even sized cubes.
Heat oil in a non-stick pan, add mustard seeds and let them splutter. Add 7-8 curry leaves, tandoori masala powder and dhokla cubes. Toss well and cook for 30 seconds.
Transfer the dhokla cubes onto a serving platter, garnish with coriander and serve hot.

title: Yorkshire Pudding - -SK Khazana Recipe Card
description:
'A classic British dish that is served as a side dish
'
method: Preheat the oven to 190˚C.
Pour oil into each cavity of a cupcake mould, place it in the hot oven for 15 minutes or till it smokes.
Meanwhile, sieve refined flour into a large bowl. Add salt and break in the eggs and whisk till well combined.
Add milk, little at a time, and whisk continuously till you get a lump free mixture.
Strain the mixture into a pouring jar and pour into each cupcake cavity till ¾ full. Place it back in the oven and bake for 25 minutes.

Place some grilled chicken and sautéed vegetables on each serving plate. Place 2-3 Yorkshire puddings on each serving plate, pour brown sauce on top of them and drizzle over the grilled chicken, sautéed vegetables. Garnish with micro greens and serve hot.

title: Tandalachi Bhakri
description:
'Favourite meal of rural Maharashtra â€“ very wholesome and totally delicious when eaten hot 
'
method: Heat 2 cups of water in a deep non-stick bottom pan, add salt and let the water come to a boil. Add rice flour and mix well. Cover and cook for 4-5 minutes on medium heat.
Transfer the mixture in a parat, sprinkle a little water from time to time and knead, while it is still hot, into soft dough.
Divide the dough into equal portions and shape them into balls. Dust the worktop with a little rice flour and place a ball on it and flatten it slightly. Then roll into a thin disc. This is a bhakri.

Heat a non-stick tawa, place the bhakri on it and apply a little water on top, flip and cook, turning sides till light brown specks appear. Take the bhakri off the tawa and place it on direct flame when it will puff up. Turn and cook the other side too.  Cook the remaining dough similarly.
Place the bhakris on serving plates and serve hot with pitla, onion cubes and green chillies.

title: Tadgola Mojito
description:
'We usually eat tadgola just by itself, try this drink and you will keep wanting to make it again and again
'
method: For each portion, rub the rim of a serving jar with a lemon cube and dip in salt.
Roughly chop ice apples and put them in the prepared serving jar. Add 4 lemon cubes, 15-20 mint leaves and black salt and muddle well with a muddler.
Add 2 tbsps sugar syrup, 4-5 ice cubes and top up with water. Stir well with a straw.
Garnish with lemon slices and serve immediately.

title: Sushi
description:
'You need to cultivate a taste to enjoy sushi, a popular Japanese snack 
'
method: Heat a deep non-stick pan, add sushi rice, 2 cups water and salt and mix well. Let it come to a boil, reduce heat, cover and cook till the rice is soft and sticky.
Transfer the cooked rice into a large bowl and allow to cool.
Remove seeds and cut cucumber into sticks. Remove seeds and cut red capsicum into strips. Cut asparagus into 2 inch pieces.
Add sugar and vinegar to the rice and mash well.

Place a nori sheet on a sushi mat, spread some rice on it evenly. Dip a finger in water and press it down to create an even layer leaving a bit of the edges empty. Place a few cucumber sticks, red capsicum sticks and tightly roll the sushi along with the sushi mat. Remove the mat and place the roll on a plate.

Place another nori sheet on the same mat, spread some rice evenly leaving a bit of the edge empty. Place a few salmon pieces and a few asparagus pieces on the rice. Roll it tightly using the sushi mat. Remove the mat and place the roll on a plate.
Cut the prepared sushi into 1 inch pieces and place them on a serving plate and serve with soy sauce dip.

title: Sugarcane Mojito
description:
'Sugarcane juice is very healthy and soothing especially during hot months
'
ingredients: Black salt (kala namak) 1 teaspoon + for rimming
Black pepper powder 1 teaspoon + for rimming
method: Cut 2 lemon into eight pieces and add it to a large jar, add a few mint leaves, and muddle them together.
Add salt, black salt, black pepper powder snd squeeze the juice of 2 lemons into it. Add sugarcane juice, and mix well.
Take some black salt, black pepper powder and a little salt and mix well. Apply a little lemon juice on the rims of 4 serving glasses and press them over this mixture.
Put some ice cubes in these rimmed glasses, a few lemon slices, a few mint leaves and strain the sugarcane mixture directly into the glasses.
Mix well and serve chilled.
